alert.note: Alert for Grant; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:01PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL GRANT AND WESTERN PENDLETON COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 301 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Williamstown, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Butler, Goforth, Stewartsville, Greenwood, Cherry Grove, Northcutt, Williamstown Lake, Gardnersville, Knoxville, Twin Bridges, Catawba, Camp Northward, Gene Snyder Airport, Holbrook, Sherman, Lawrenceville and Cordova. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 149 and 163. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
